metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20505 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
SQLite 3.25.2, when queries are run on a table with a malformed PRIMARY KEY, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) by leveraging the ability to run arbitrary SQL statements (such as in certain WebSQL use cases).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20505` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.1
libsqlite3-0 - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.1
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.1
sqlite3 - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sqlite3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.22.0-1ubuntu0.1').
